Genetically, E. romaleae SJ-2008 is closely related to other Encephalitozoon species, which are known to infect a variety of vertebrate and invertebrate hosts. However, the specific host range and pathogenic effects of E. romaleae SJ-2008 are still under investigation, as this species was only recently discovered and characterized.

Overall, the study of E. romaleae SJ-2008 and other microsporidian parasites can provide insights into the evolutionary adaptations and ecological interactions of these intriguing and understudied organisms.
